channel.title: reversing on x0r19x91's blog
channel.description: Recent content in reversing on x0r19x91's blog

item.title: Code Injection: Windows Taskbar
item.description:
Description

I will be describing how to inject arbritary code into explorer.exe using the Taskbar.
I was looking in the taskbar MSTaskListWClass, and I found a valid pointer in the “Extra Window Bytes” for the “Running applications” window.

item.title: Google CTF 2020 - .NET
item.description: I will be describing in detail what I did and what I should have done. What I Did Saturday Evening On Saturday evening, I started with this challenge. It’s a plain .NET executable, so I opened with dnSpy and started debugging. So, this is definitely a binary written in C++/CLI. Reading the docs for Harmony, it’s clear that the above code introduces a new prefix to the methods. NUFFRA -> FYRKANTIG, GRONKULLA -> RIKTIG_OGLA, SPARSAM -> GRUNDTAL_NORRVIKEN, FLARDFULL -> DAGSTORP

ESET Crackme

item.title: Deobfuscating MoVfuscator - Part 2
item.description:
I’ll be analyzing another MoVfuscated binary, from Swamp CTF 2019 using IDA Free
Deep on the web, I discovered a secret key validation.
It appeared to be from the future, and it only had one sentence: “Risk speed for security”.
Something seems fishy, you should try to break the key and find the secret inside!
-= Created by noopnoop =-

item.title: Understanding the Movfuscator
item.description:
MoVfuscator is the PoC for the Turing Completeness of Mov instruction.
Yes, you guessed it right. It uses only mov’s, except for a few places.
This makes reversing difficult, because the control flow is obfuscated.
I’ll be analyzing the challenge Mov of UTCTF'19 using IDA Free.

item.title: InCTF 2018 - Decoy
item.description: It’s a beautiful challenge. But there is an interesting thing about this challenge. The author has tried to make a binary tree out of the basic blocks.

item.title: Minesweeper - Revealing the Mines
item.description: We all know about Minesweeper. Its all about random numbers (pseudorandom though). Is it possible to win every time ?
